isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine Service, Model Year 1994 - 1998 - VALVE TRAIN: PUSH RODS , HYDRAULIC VALVE LIFTERS AND CAMSHAFT - Push Rods and Hydraulic Valve Lifters - Installation

figure.caption: Installing the Valve Lifters Into the Crankcase

step1.para: Lubricate the valve lifters with clean engine oil. Install the valve lifters into their respective bores within the crankcase. Maintain the original direction of rotation.

note.para: Two types of valve lifter retention systems exist. The older style is a single piece valve lifter guide retainer with two retention bolts. The newer style valve lifter guides are short plates with single retention bolts.

step1.para: Install the valve lifter guides over the hydraulic valve lifters.

step2.para: Secure each single bolt style valve lifter guide (if equipped) to the crankcase with a bolt and tighten the bolts to the standard torque value.

figure.caption: Installing the Valve Lifter Guide Retainer (if equipped)

step2.para: If the engine is equipped with valve lifter guide retainers, install the retainers and secure them to the crankcase with two mounting bolts. Tighten the bolts to the standard torque value.

caution.para: To ensure the compatibility of the metallic mating surfaces of the valve lever, push rod, and valve lifter, the copper colored end must face up when installed. Be aware that the two rounded ends of the push rods are made of different materials.

step1.para: Insert the push rods into their respective positions. Make sure the copper colored ball end is facing up.
